title: Hulk Hogan involved in terrifying plane incident after ‘brakes melted’
text:
Hulk had ‘quite an experience’ on his flight to Iceland (Picture: Getty Images)

Hulk Hogan got a serious fright during a flight to Iceland when the ‘brakes melted’ as they landed.

The WWE legend was making his way to the Crown Jewel event in Saudi Arabia with fellow wrestler Jimmy Hart, and had just touched down in Iceland when the terrifying incident happened.

In video footage after the incident, Hulk explained how the plane apparently malfunctioned causing a ‘hard landing’.

While sitting on the plane, the wrestler said: ‘Alright guys, we are here in Iceland, and there’s our plane. We just had a really hard landing, blew out the tires and brakes have melted. That thing’s not going anywhere.’

Fortunately, they weren’t stranded for long as a friend from Minnesota offered to bail them out by allowing the group to board his flight to Riyadh.

‘So, over there is a buddy of ours, and he’s got the same type of plane we were on, and he’s going to be graceful enough to let us climb on board and continue the journey,’ Hulk said while pointing the camera at the second plane sitting on the tarmac.

Relieved that they were safe and would still be able to attend the Crown Jewel event, Hulk added: ‘We’re going to make it.

[It was] quite an experience landing in and all that crazy stuff happening.’

It’s been years since we’ve seen Hulk, real name Terry Bollea, in the boxing ring but there’s a chance he could make a grand return.

The 66-year-old recently revealed that he wants a ‘retirement match’ with Vince McMahon at Wrestlemania.

Hulk told the LA Times earlier in October: ‘I talked to Vince, and I said I really don’t know if I could live with myself knowing my last match was with TNA [Total Nonstop Action Wrestling].

‘If I can get fixed, I pray I can have one more match.

‘I told Vince, “When I get through this back surgery, I’m going to get in the best shape of my life and we’re going to talk about me having one last retirement match”.’
